node.title: Insomnia at home, falling asleep at the wheel: Former Coles managers tell of overwork and impossible demands
node.alt: A middle-aged woman with short hair and glasses looks into camera with a serious expression.
node.description: Former Coles managers allege a culture of overwork and underpayment at the supermarket giant as it faces legal action from the Fair Work Ombudsman as well as a class action on behalf of 2,200 workers.
node.content:
["When the demands on Erika Macdonald were at their most punishing, the former Coles manager says she was sleeping just one or two hours a night.", "\"If I did wake up in the middle of night, I would think, 'I've still got so much to do,'\" she says.", "\"I often got up at one o'clock in the morning and would start working.", "Ms Macdonald joined the supermarket giant in Perth as a contractor in 2016, and over the next three years rose to become a regional manager overseeing 120 cleaning and trolley-collecting staff across 11 stores.", "She says she ended up working up to 80 hours a week to meet the targets set by her superiors.", "\"It wasn't unusual during the Christmas period for me to take 120 calls in a day.\"", "She says she was so sleep deprived that several times she fell asleep at the wheel driving between stores.", "Ms Macdonald says that on top of performance targets, managers in her role were also ranked against each other on a \"ladder\".", "\"Even if you achieve your budget and achieve your targets, you could still be number eight in the region,\" she says.", "She says Coles would sit her down and say, 'Why are you number eight? You need to look at this and get better.'", "She says the pressure left her with extreme anxiety, leading her to lodge a workers compensation claim in January last year.", "", "
Ms Macdonald wants to bring attention to the issues of overwork and underpayment in retail.(ABC News: Robert Koenigluck)
", "Coles sent her for a mental health assessment, and the psychiatrist diagnosed her with an adjustment disorder with insomnia caused by the \"excessive hours\" and \"excessive demands\" of her job.", "The psychiatrist said she could return to work but only in the mornings on reduced hours.", "But Coles told her there were no such positions available, and later offered her a redundancy.", "\"It was devastating,\" she says.", "\"Just no commitment from the company. No give and take. It's just, we'll take and when we can't use you, you've got to go.\"", "Ms Macdonald says she's been so traumatised by her experience, these days she can't bring herself to enter a Coles store.", "Coles has declined to comment on Ms Macdonald's case.", "
Coles facing legal fight on two fronts over underpayment claims
", "Ms Macdonald is part of a class action being run on behalf of Coles staff which accuses the nation's second-largest private employer of underpaying its salaried managers by more than $300 million.", "She hopes the case brings attention to underpayment\u00a0and overwork across the retail industry.", "\"That has to change \u2013 putting profits before people,\" she says.", "\"You can't just chase the bottom line and think it won't have [an] impact on the people delivering that bottom line for you.", "\"Look after your people\u00a0and the profits will come.\"", "", "
Coles has said the underpayments affect about 1 per cent of its staff.(ABC News: Andrew Altree-Williams)
", "The class action comes as Coles faces legal action from the Fair Work Ombudsman (FWO) over alleged underpayment of its managers. The FWO puts the underpayment at more than $100 million between 2017 and 2020.", "In a statement made after filing proceedings in the Federal Court last week, the FWO alleges one worker was underpaid $471,647 during the period.", "Beneath those hard numbers are the personal stories of almost 8,000 Coles managers like Ms Macdonald, for whom the allegations represent not only underpayment but years of stress and anxiety while working for the supermarket giant.", "In a statement to the share market last week after the FWO launched its legal action, Coles said it was \"reviewing the proceedings \u2026 and to the extent that further remediation may be required, we will update the market accordingly\".", "Coles first revealed in February last year it had discovered underpayments worth about $20 million, impacting about 1 per cent of its total staff.", "In its latest statement, it says it has apologised to affected staff and either repaid or set aside $23 million for remediation.", "But Adero Law principal Rory Markham, who is running the class action against Coles, says the company has vastly underestimated the underpayments.", "\"When you're paid a flat salary, as in the case of Coles managers, there's no allowance for overtime or excessive hours,\" he says.", "", "
Adero Law principal Rory Markham is running the class action on behalf of more than 2,000 current and former Coles staff.(ABC News: David Maguire)
", "He says information from the roughly 2,200 salaried staff who have signed up for the class action show they were working an average of 55 to 65 hours a week \u2014\u00a0well above their typical contracted roster of 40 hours.", "\"The real concern with Coles is that their system of staffing and resourcing reflects a budget and a desire to achieve a sale rather than the reality of how many hours it takes to actually achieve that sale,\" Mr Markham says.", "
Rostering system underestimates needs for staff, former manager says
", "ABC Investigations has obtained a copy of a user manual for Coles' sales-data-driven rostering system, known as OneTeam.", "The document is from 2018, but the system is understood to be largely unchanged.", "Coles declined to comment on exactly how the system operates, but the manual makes clear that part-time and casual shifts in its supermarkets are allocated using estimates of product sales.", "Sales of more labour-intensive products generate a higher number of shifts.", "In the bakery department, for example, sales of doughnuts and bread baked in-store generate more hours than bread sourced from external suppliers.", "The manual says: \"OneTeam gives us a simple way to roster the right team at the right time.\"", "But Daragh Whelan says at the store he managed in Melbourne's outer east, OneTeam routinely underestimated the number of shifts needed to get all the work done.", "He says that meant salaried managers were regularly required to take on additional work after part-time and casual staff clocked off.", "", "
Daragh Whelan says Coles'\u00a0rostering system does not recognise the amount of time it takes to complete some tasks.(Supplied)
", "\"Essentially the department manager, the store manager, has got to stay back and just do it themselves,\" he says.", "\"That was happening every day, that we had to absorb work that couldn't be done due to lack of hours.\"", "He says he was also under pressure to complete tasks that were not factored into OneTeam's calculations.", "\"OneTeam gave you four hours a day to just do a quick tidy across the shop.\"", "But he says Coles \"expected everything to be fully faced and perfect\", which might take 12 hours.", "Mr Whelan says he was working up to 18 hours a day during the height of the panic buying and hoarding at supermarkets at the start of the pandemic last year.", "\"It was actually impossible to manage the store and \u2026 maintain any sort of standard\u00a0because you were just working minute to minute,\" he says.", "He says the long hours had a big impact on his family, including his ability to help at home with his now two-year-old son.", "\"I wouldn't be able to contribute like I should at home, or I'd be cranky or absent minded, because my mind was half on work,\" he says.", "He has since been diagnosed with severe depression and post-traumatic stress disorder, which he says\u00a0are directly related to his employment with \u2014\u00a0and departure from \u2014\u00a0Coles.", "", "
Mr Whelan says the demands of his job impacted his family life.(ABC News: Andrew Altree-Williams)
", "Mr Whelan says\u00a0Coles targeted him for speaking up about its workplace practices.", "In April this year, Coles suspended Mr Whelan from his store manager position, accusing him of drastically marking down products for his own benefit.", "He says\u00a0he was accused of fraudulent practices and escorted from the premises \"with no real explanation, or no question as to what my explanation or side of the story might have been\".", "The suspension came less than a week after he sent an email to Coles saying he could not \"cope with any more pressure\" after months of understaffing at the store and asking for more help.", "", "
Mr Whelan's career at Coles came to a sudden end in April when the company suspended him.(Supplied)
", "\"I was in pure shock,\" he says.", "\"I essentially had a bit of a breakdown.\"", "The products he was accused of marking down and selling to himself included an electric razor, a packet of toilet paper and a bottle of tomato sauce.", "Mr Whelan denies he broke the company's code of conduct but resigned after being given a first and final warning in July.", "He has since launched an unfair dismissal claim against Coles, accusing the company of humiliating him to the point where he could not return to his job.", "Coles has declined to do an interview and has not responded to questions, saying it is unable to comment on matters before court.", "But in its defence filed in the unfair dismissal proceedings, it denies Mr Whelan was targeted over his email and says the disciplinary action was warranted.", "It says it was already investigating Mr Whelan about the markdowns before he sent his letter.", "", "
Mr Whelan says after his suspension, he felt so humiliated he could not return to his job.(Supplied)
", "Mr Whelan once dreamed of climbing the corporate ladder at Coles to a senior position at the company's headquarters in Melbourne.", "But these days he says walking into a Coles store brings back memories of the pressure and unpaid overtime he tolerated for almost a decade in exchange for promotions and the promise of big pay rises.", "\"They are so intent at squeezing every cent that they can out of every single situation and scenario that they can,\" he says.", "\"You will be a hero when you can deliver it. But you'll go to zero just as quick.", "\"It's a sort of doom loop of the carrot dangling in front of you.", "\"You think you'll get there, and you work yourself to the ground to get there,\u00a0and you never get there.\""]
